answers.answer: If you are taking Lantis it is because you have diabetes and your pancreas doesn't function normally.  Lantis is needed to regulate diabetes and do the job of that organ.

To my knowledge, Lantus does not interfere with the Pancreas. However, tell your doctor and pharmacist what prescription and nonprescription medications you are taking, including any supplements and vitamins or herbal products.
Correction, I got interrupted and clicked on Post Comment before I finished the sentence.The ending should have said, "....or herbal products as they may interact with Lantus in a negative manner."
